group_1.textLeft: ...Now that we're here, no one shall be able@to hear us.

group_1.textRight: A secret of yours that you don't want anyone else@to hear...!
I-is it really okay for Miyu to hear about something@THAT special, Lady San...?!

group_1.textLeft: It's because you're Miyu that I'm telling you this.

group_1.textRight: Wh-wh-what... What's this all of a sudden?!@Lady San giving Miyu special treatment...!
Even though it's already enough for Miyu,
being able to stay by your side and see those@beeeautiful legs...!

group_1.textLeft: ...You seem to be misunderstanding something.
Since you're a member of the student section@of the Youth Association...
It's only natural that I'd tell you about the ruckus@surrounding the Fire Festival back then.

group_1.textRight: I thought you were going to tell Miyu your secret...!

group_1.textLeft: ...Well, it does have something to do with that.
It's because you're a Magical Girl and were once in@the Wings of the Magius that I'm telling you this.

group_1.textRight: Um, um... could it be that your wish was involved,@Lady San...?

group_1.textLeft: That's right.
My wish has something to do with the Youth@Association and the Fire Festival.
So, to tell the whole story, first...
...I'd have to start with what led me to join@the Youth Association.

group_1.narration: "Until starting elementary school,@I was generally rather timid and shy."
"One time, my parents took me to a fire festival@organized by the Hikarizuka Shrine@and the Hikarizuka Youth Association."
"But seeing the huge flames of the Festival@for the first time and hearing the loud@shouting of the adults scared me so much..."

group_1.textRight: You're gonna be missing out on the real deal@if you leave now, young lady.

group_1.textLeft: Huh...?

group_1.textRight: We Youth Association guys here can see the god@in the flames.
First thing we gotta do is jump into that fire and@welcome the god.
C'mon, don't be scared.@Look at this.

group_1.narration: ―Tatsu―@Now, what d'you say, lil' lady?@You see the god?
―Tatsu―@I mean, even a guy like me does.@It's no wonder you can see the god too.
―Tatsu―@Next year, let's dance and make merry together@to welcome and entertain the god.

group_1.textRight: With how rude everybody in the Youth Association@usually is,
I'm surprised that they were so kind to the younger@Lady San...

group_1.textLeft: Well, they all tend to be quite rough around the@edges because of their downtown nature.
I was a little scared at first...
But, out of my admiration of how cool they were,@I joined the student section of the Youth Association.
I was trying so hard to start conversations,
the next thing I knew, I'd gotten over my fear.

group_1.textRight: The reason why you're the way you are today is@because you joined the Youth Association, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, indeed.
And it was also because of my admiration for@everyone...
...that I began to devote myself to Fire Festival@dancing and playing Japanese instruments...
It's just that...@ever since I started middle school...
The Festival has been the scapegoat of a lot of@public issues...
They say that a festival where people jump into@the fire is barbaric and dangerous...
And well... our guys can be rowdy, and sometimes@they get into fights...

group_1.textRight: But, when you say "fights", don't you mean just@squabbles among friends?

group_1.textLeft: Outsiders wouldn't understand that sort of thing.
The prejudice that the Festival and those involved@were dangerous grew stronger and stronger...
Until eventually, a movement to abolish@the Fire Festival began.
